bkietz commented on pull request #4268: ARROW-4505: [C++] adding pretty print for dates, times, and timestamps
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4268
 
 
   | type | fmt |
   |---|---|
   | DATE32 (days since epoch) | YYYY-MM-DD |
   | DATE64 (milliseconds since epoch) | YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss.xxx |
   | TIMESTAMP (`<TimeUnit>` since epoch) | YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss.xxx<timezone> |
   | TIME32 (`<TimeUnit>` since midnight) | HH:mm:ss.xxx |
   | TIME64 (`<TimeUnit>` since midnight) | HH:mm:ss.xxx |

kou commented on pull request #4268: ARROW-4505: [C++] adding pretty print for dates, times, and timestamps
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4268#discussion_r281876272
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/pretty_print.cc
 ##########
 @@ -143,13 +145,51 @@ class ArrayPrinter : public PrettyPrinter {
   }
 
   template <typename T>
-  inline typename std::enable_if<IsInteger<T>::value, Status>::type WriteDataValues(
-      const T& array) {
+  inline typename std::enable_if<
+      IsInteger<T>::value && !is_date<typename T::TypeClass>::value &&
+          !is_time<typename T::TypeClass>::value &&
+          !std::is_same<TimestampType, typename T::TypeClass>::value,
 
 Review comment:
   `!is_date<typename T::TypeClass>::value` and `!std::is_same<TimestampType, typename T::TypeClass>::value` are needless.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on pull request #4268: ARROW-4505: [C++] adding pretty print for dates, times, and timestamps
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4268#discussion_r281836217
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/type.h
 ##########
 @@ -691,7 +691,7 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT Time64Type : public TimeType {
 
   int bit_width() const override { return static_cast<int>(sizeof(c_type) * CHAR_BIT); }
 
-  explicit Time64Type(TimeUnit::type unit = TimeUnit::MILLI);
+  explicit Time64Type(TimeUnit::type unit = TimeUnit::MICRO);
 
 Review comment:
   `TimeUnit::NANO` may be better because `Time32Type` uses `TimeUnit::MILLI` not `TimeUnit::SECOND`.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

xhochy commented on pull request #4268: ARROW-4505: [C++] adding pretty print for dates, times, and timestamps
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4268#discussion_r282020630
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/type.h
 ##########
 @@ -691,7 +691,7 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT Time64Type : public TimeType {
 
   int bit_width() const override { return static_cast<int>(sizeof(c_type) * CHAR_BIT); }
 
-  explicit Time64Type(TimeUnit::type unit = TimeUnit::MILLI);
+  explicit Time64Type(TimeUnit::type unit = TimeUnit::MICRO);
 
 Review comment:
   Any reasons to change the default here? This is a quite hidden breaking change.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

kou commented on pull request #4268: ARROW-4505: [C++] adding pretty print for dates, times, and timestamps
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4268#discussion_r282283132
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/type.h
 ##########
 @@ -691,7 +691,7 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT Time64Type : public TimeType {
 
   int bit_width() const override { return static_cast<int>(sizeof(c_type) * CHAR_BIT); }
 
-  explicit Time64Type(TimeUnit::type unit = TimeUnit::MILLI);
+  explicit Time64Type(TimeUnit::type unit = TimeUnit::MICRO);
 
 Review comment:
   I think that `TimeUnit::MILLI` is invalid because https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/arrow/type.h#L112-L114 says:
   
   ```cpp
       /// Time as signed 64-bit integer, representing either microseconds or
       /// nanoseconds since midnight
       TIME64,
   ```
   
   So I think that this is just a bug fix.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org
